DataElement.preferredName: Patient Strong Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibition Medication Eligibility Determination Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not applicable coded response regarding whether a patient has received a strong Cytochrome P450 3A4 inhibitor that would determine their eligibility to participate in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Strong Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibition Medication Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected._Cytochrome P450 3A4 (503 aa, ~57 kDa) is encoded by the human CYP3A4 gene. This protein is involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids and xenobiotics._The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Strong Cytochrome P450 3A4 Inhibition Medication Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.:Cytochrome P450 3A4 (503 aa, ~57 kDa) is encoded by the human CYP3A4 gene. This protein is involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids and xenobiotics.:The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.
Cytochrome P450 3A4 (503 aa, ~57 kDa) is encoded by the human CYP3A4 gene. This protein is involved in the oxidation of steroids, fatty acids and xenobiotics.
The interference with or prevention of an action or response even though the stimulus for that action or response is present.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient receiving concurre
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving concurrent use of strong CYP3A inhibitors such as ketoconazole, itraconazole, voriconazole, posaconazole, nefazodone, and clarithromycin less than or equal to 7 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving warfarin or CYP3A inhibitors such as ketoconazole and clarithromycin within 7 days prior to the first dose of navitoclax or during navitoclax administration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving concurrent use of strong CYP3A inhibitors such as ketoconazole, itraconazole, voriconazole, posaconazole, nefazodone, and clarithromycin?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a strong cytochrome P450 (CYP) 3A inhibitor within 7 days prior to the first dose of ibrutinib or requires continuous treatment with a strong CYP 450 3A inhibitor?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving any medications or substances that are strong inhibitors or inducers of CYP3A4/5?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does require concomitant use of known strong CYP3A inhibitors (eg. itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir) or moderate CYP3A inhibitors (eg. ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, diltiazem, fluconazole, verapamil)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require the concomitant use of known strong CYP3A inhibitors (eg. itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir) or moderate CYP3A inhibitors (eg. ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, diltiazem, fluconazole, verapamil) and patient has received these agents within 2 weeks prior to starting olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received strong or moderate CYP3A inhibitors within 2 weeks of starting olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving concomitant treatment with OATP and BCRP inhibitors or strong inducers/inhibitors of cytochrome P450 (CYP)3A4/5, has treatment with these agents been discontinued at least 14 days prior to MLN7243 (TAK-243) dosing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is receiving concomitant treatment with OATP with BCRP inhibitors or strong inducers/inhibitors of cytochrome P450 (CYP)3A4/5, has treatment with these agents been discontinued at least 14 days prior to MLN7243 (TAK-243) dosing?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received strong (e.g., itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir) or moderate (e.g., ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, diltiazem, fluconazole, verapamil) CYP3A inhibitors within 2 weeks prior to starting olaparib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require the concomitant use of known strong CYP3A inhibitors (e.g. itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir) or moderate CYP3A inhibitors (eg. ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, diltiazem, fluconazole, verapamil) and has not met the required two week washout period  prior to starting study treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently using strong CYP3A inhibitors (e.g. itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir) or moderate CYP3A inhibitors (e.g. ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, diltiazem, fluconazole, verapamil)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have the concomitant use of known strong CYP3A inhibitors (e.g., itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir) or moderate CYP3A inhibitors (e.g., ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, diltiazem, fluconazole, verapamil)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving concomitant known strong CYP3A inhibitors (e.g. itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir) or moderate CYP3A inhibitors (e.g. ciprofloxacin, erythromycin, diltiazem, fluconazole, verapamil) with a required washout period prior to starting study treatment of 2 weeks?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient require the concomitant use of known strong CYP3A inhibitors (e.g., itraconazole, telithromycin, clarithromycin, protease inhibitors boosted with ritonavir or cobicistat, indinavir, saquinavir, nelfinavir, boceprevir, telaprevir)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient receiving treatment with strong CYP3A inhibitors or strong CYP3A inducers within 2 weeks or 5 drug-elimination half-lives, whichever is longer, prior to initiation of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received known strong or moderate CYP3A4 inhibitors, or strong CYP3A4 inducers within 7 days of enrollment with the exception of the antifungal (See 3.1.10) or sensitive/narrow therapeutic substrates of MATE1?
